intro: Calosmon neesianum, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, typically blooming in spring. Calosmon neesianum is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has cultural significance to Māori and is used in traditional weaving practices.
